an6.62:0.3.eng: Knowledge of the Faculties of Persons

an6.62:1.2.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā kosalesu cārikaṃ caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ yena daṇḍakappakaṃ nāma kosalānaṃ nigamo tadavasari.
an6.62:1.2.eng: At one time the Buddha was wandering in the land of the Kosalans together with a large Saṅgha of mendicants when he arrived at a town of the Kosalans named Daṇḍakappaka.

an6.62:1.3.pli: Atha kho bhagavā maggā okkamma aññatarasmiṃ rukkhamūle paññatte āsane nisīdi.
an6.62:1.3.eng: The Buddha left the road and sat at the root of a tree on the seat spread out.

an6.62:1.4.pli: Te ca bhikkhū daṇḍakappakaṃ pavisiṃsu āvasathaṃ pariyesituṃ.
an6.62:1.4.eng: The mendicants entered Daṇḍakappaka to look for a guest house.

an6.62:2.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando sambahulehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ yena aciravatī nadī tenupasaṅkami gattāni parisiñcituṃ.
an6.62:2.1.eng: Then Venerable Ānanda together with several mendicants went to the Aciravatī River to bathe.

an6.62:2.2.pli: Aciravatiyā nadiyā gattāni parisiñcitvā paccuttaritvā ekacīvaro aṭṭhāsi gattāni pubbāpayamāno.
an6.62:2.2.eng: When he had bathed and emerged from the water he stood in one robe drying his limbs.

an6.62:2.3.pli: Atha kho aññataro bhikkhu yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ etadavoca:
an6.62:2.3.eng: Then a certain mendicant went up to Venerable Ānanda, and said to him,

an6.62:2.4.pli: “kiṃ nu kho, āvuso ānanda, sabbaṃ cetaso samannāharitvā nu kho devadatto bhagavatā byākato:
an6.62:2.4.eng: “Reverend Ānanda, when the Buddha declared that Devadatta was

an6.62:2.5.pli: ‘āpāyiko devadatto nerayiko kappaṭṭho atekiccho’ti, udāhu kenacideva pariyāyenāti?
an6.62:2.5.eng: going to a place of loss, to hell, there to remain for an eon, irredeemable, did he do so after wholeheartedly deliberating, or was this just a way of speaking?”

an6.62:2.6.pli: Evaṃ kho panetaṃ, āvuso, bhagavatā byākatan”ti.
an6.62:2.6.eng: “You’re right, reverend, that’s how the Buddha declared it.”

an6.62:3.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
an6.62:3.1.eng: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and told him what had happened.

an6.62:3.2.pli: “idhāhaṃ, bhante, sambahulehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ yena aciravatī nadī tenupasaṅkamiṃ gattāni parisiñcituṃ.

an6.62:3.3.pli: Aciravatiyā nadiyā gattāni parisiñcitvā paccuttaritvā ekacīvaro aṭṭhāsiṃ gattāni pubbāpayamāno.

an6.62:3.4.pli: Atha kho, bhante, aññataro bhikkhu yenāhaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā maṃ etadavoca:

an6.62:3.5.pli: ‘kiṃ nu kho, āvuso ānanda, sabbaṃ cetaso samannāharitvā nu kho devadatto bhagavatā byākato—

an6.62:3.6.pli: āpāyiko devadatto nerayiko kappaṭṭho atekicchoti, udāhu kenacideva pariyāyenā’ti?

an6.62:3.7.pli: Evaṃ vutte, ahaṃ, bhante, taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavocaṃ:

an6.62:4.1.pli: “So vā kho, ānanda, bhikkhu navo bhavissati acirapabbajito, thero vā pana bālo abyatto.
an6.62:4.1.eng: “Ānanda, that mendicant must be junior, recently gone forth, or else a foolish, incompetent senior mendicant.

an6.62:4.2.pli: Kathañhi nāma yaṃ mayā ekaṃsena byākataṃ tattha dvejjhaṃ āpajjissati.
an6.62:4.2.eng: How on earth can he take something that I have declared categorically to be ambiguous?

an6.62:4.3.pli: Nāhaṃ, ānanda, aññaṃ ekapuggalampi samanupassāmi, yo evaṃ mayā sabbaṃ cetaso samannāharitvā byākato, yathayidaṃ devadatto.
an6.62:4.3.eng: I do not see a single other individual about whom I have given such whole-hearted deliberation before making a declaration as I did in the case of Devadatta.

an6.62:4.4.pli: Yāvakīvañcāhaṃ, ānanda, devadattassa vālaggakoṭinittudanamattampi sukkadhammaṃ addasaṃ;
an6.62:4.4.eng: As long as I saw even a fraction of a hair’s tip of goodness in Devadatta

an6.62:4.5.eng: I did not declare that he was

an6.62:4.6.eng: going to a place of loss, to hell, there to remain for an eon, irredeemable.

an6.62:4.7.pli: Yato ca kho ahaṃ, ānanda, devadattassa vālaggakoṭinittudanamattampi sukkadhammaṃ na addasaṃ;
an6.62:4.7.eng: But when I saw that there was not even a fraction of a hair’s tip of goodness in Devadatta

an6.62:4.9.eng: going to a place of loss, to hell, there to remain for an eon, irredeemable.

an6.62:5.1.pli: Seyyathāpi, ānanda, gūthakūpo sādhikaporiso pūro gūthassa samatittiko.
an6.62:5.1.eng: Suppose there was a sewer deeper than a man’s height, full to the brim with feces,

an6.62:5.2.eng: and someone was sunk into it over their head.

an6.62:5.3.pli: Tassa kocideva puriso uppajjeyya atthakāmo hitakāmo yogakkhemakāmo tamhā gūthakūpā uddharitukāmo.
an6.62:5.3.eng: Then along comes a person who wants to help make them safe, who wants to lift them out of that sewer.

an6.62:5.4.pli: So taṃ gūthakūpaṃ samantānuparigacchanto neva passeyya tassa purisassa vālaggakoṭinittudanamattampi gūthena amakkhitaṃ, yattha taṃ gahetvā uddhareyya.
an6.62:5.4.eng: But circling all around the sewer they couldn’t see even a fraction of a hair’s tip of that person that was not smeared with feces.

an6.62:5.5.pli: Evamevaṃ kho ahaṃ, ānanda, yato devadattassa vālaggakoṭinittudanamattampi sukkadhammaṃ na addasaṃ;
an6.62:5.5.eng: In the same way, when I saw that there was not even a fraction of a hair’s tip of goodness in Devadatta

an6.62:5.7.eng: going to a place of loss, to hell, there to remain for an eon, irredeemable.

an6.62:5.8.pli: Sace tumhe, ānanda, suṇeyyātha tathāgatassa purisindriyañāṇāni vibhajissāmī”ti?
an6.62:5.8.eng: If you would all listen, Ānanda, I will analyze the Realized One’s knowledges of the faculties of persons.”

an6.62:6.1.eng: “Now is the time, Blessed One! Now is the time, Holy One!

an6.62:6.2.pli: yaṃ bhagavā purisindriyañāṇāni vibhajeyya. Bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī”ti.
an6.62:6.2.eng: Let the Buddha analyze the faculties of persons. The mendicants will listen and remember it.”

an6.62:6.3.eng: “Well then, Ānanda, listen and apply your mind well, I will speak.”

an6.62:6.4.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paccassosi.

an6.62:7.1.pli: “Idhāhaṃ, ānanda, ekaccaṃ puggalaṃ evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāmi:
an6.62:7.1.eng: “Ānanda, when I’ve comprehended the mind of an individual, I understand:

an6.62:7.2.pli: ‘imassa kho puggalassa vijjamānā kusalāpi dhammā akusalāpi dhammā’ti.
an6.62:7.2.eng: ‘Both skillful and unskillful qualities are found in this individual.’

an6.62:7.3.pli: Tamenaṃ aparena samayena evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāmi:
an6.62:7.3.eng: After some time I encompass their mind and understand:

an6.62:7.4.pli: ‘imassa kho puggalassa kusalā dhammā antarahitā, akusalā dhammā sammukhībhūtā.
an6.62:7.4.eng: ‘The skillful qualities of this individual have vanished, but the unskillful qualities are still present.

an6.62:7.5.pli: Atthi ca khvassa kusalamūlaṃ asamucchinnaṃ, tamhā tassa kusalā kusalaṃ pātubhavissati.
an6.62:7.5.eng: Nevertheless, their skillful root is unbroken, and from that the skillful will appear.

an6.62:7.6.eng: So this individual is not liable to decline in the future.’

an6.62:7.7.pli: Seyyathāpi, ānanda, bījāni akhaṇḍāni apūtīni avātātapahatāni sāradāni sukhasayitāni sukhette suparikammakatāya bhūmiyā nikkhittāni.
an6.62:7.7.eng: Suppose some seeds were intact, unspoiled, not weather-damaged, fertile, and well-kept. They’re sown in a well-prepared, productive field.

an6.62:7.8.pli: Jāneyyāsi tvaṃ, ānanda, imāni bījāni vuddhiṃ virūḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjissantī”ti?
an6.62:7.8.eng: Wouldn’t you know that those seeds would grow, increase, and mature?”

an6.62:7.10.pli: “Evamevaṃ kho ahaṃ, ānanda, idhekaccaṃ puggalaṃ evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāmi:
an6.62:7.10.eng: “In the same way, when I’ve comprehended the mind of an individual, I understand …

an6.62:7.11.pli: ‘imassa kho puggalassa vijjamānā kusalāpi dhammā akusalāpi dhammā’ti.

an6.62:7.12.pli: Tamenaṃ aparena samayena evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāmi:

an6.62:7.13.pli: ‘imassa kho puggalassa kusalā dhammā antarahitā, akusalā dhammā sammukhībhūtā.

an6.62:7.14.pli: Atthi ca khvassa kusalamūlaṃ asamucchinnaṃ, tamhā tassa kusalā kusalaṃ pātubhavissati.

an6.62:7.15.eng: This individual is not liable to decline in the future …

an6.62:7.16.pli: Evampi kho, ānanda, tathāgatassa purisapuggalo cetasā ceto paricca vidito hoti.
an6.62:7.16.eng: This is how another individual is known to the Realized One by encompassing their mind.

an6.62:7.17.pli: Evampi kho, ānanda, tathāgatassa purisindriyañāṇaṃ cetasā ceto paricca viditaṃ hoti.
an6.62:7.17.eng: And this is how the Realized One knows a person’s faculties by encompassing their mind.

an6.62:7.18.pli: Evampi kho, ānanda, tathāgatassa āyatiṃ dhammasamuppādo cetasā ceto paricca vidito hoti.
an6.62:7.18.eng: And this is how the Realized One knows the future origination of a person’s qualities by encompassing their mind.

an6.62:8.1.pli: Idha panāhaṃ, ānanda, ekaccaṃ puggalaṃ evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāmi:
an6.62:8.1.eng: When I’ve comprehended the mind of an individual, I understand:

an6.62:8.2.pli: ‘imassa kho puggalassa vijjamānā kusalāpi dhammā akusalāpi dhammā’ti.
an6.62:8.2.eng: ‘Both skillful and unskillful qualities are found in this individual.’

an6.62:8.3.pli: Tamenaṃ aparena samayena evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāmi:
an6.62:8.3.eng: After some time I encompass their mind and understand:

an6.62:8.4.pli: ‘imassa kho puggalassa akusalā dhammā antarahitā, kusalā dhammā sammukhībhūtā.
an6.62:8.4.eng: ‘The unskillful qualities of this individual have vanished, but the skillful qualities are still present.

an6.62:8.5.pli: Atthi ca khvassa akusalamūlaṃ asamucchinnaṃ, tamhā tassa akusalā akusalaṃ pātubhavissati.
an6.62:8.5.eng: Nevertheless, their unskillful root is unbroken, and from that the unskillful will appear.

an6.62:8.6.eng: So this individual is still liable to decline in the future.’

an6.62:8.7.pli: Seyyathāpi, ānanda, bījāni akhaṇḍāni apūtīni avātātapahatāni sāradāni sukhasayitāni puthusilāya nikkhittāni.
an6.62:8.7.eng: Suppose some seeds were intact, unspoiled, not weather-damaged, fertile, and well-kept. And they were sown on a broad rock.

an6.62:8.8.pli: Jāneyyāsi tvaṃ, ānanda, nayimāni bījāni vuddhiṃ virūḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjissantī”ti?
an6.62:8.8.eng: Wouldn’t you know that those seeds would not grow, increase, and mature?”

an6.62:8.10.pli: “Evamevaṃ kho ahaṃ, ānanda, idhekaccaṃ puggalaṃ evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāmi:
an6.62:8.10.eng: “In the same way, when I’ve comprehended the mind of an individual, I understand …

an6.62:8.11.pli: ‘imassa kho puggalassa vijjamānā kusalāpi dhammā akusalāpi dhammā’ti.

an6.62:8.12.pli: Tamenaṃ aparena samayena evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāmi:

an6.62:8.13.pli: ‘imassa kho puggalassa akusalā dhammā antarahitā, kusalā dhammā sammukhībhūtā.

an6.62:8.14.pli: Atthi ca khvassa akusalamūlaṃ asamucchinnaṃ, tamhā tassa akusalā akusalaṃ pātubhavissati.

an6.62:8.15.eng: This individual is still liable to decline in the future …

an6.62:8.16.pli: Evampi kho, ānanda, tathāgatassa purisapuggalo cetasā ceto paricca vidito hoti.
an6.62:8.16.eng: This is how another individual is known to the Realized One …

an6.62:8.17.pli: Evampi kho, ānanda, tathāgatassa purisindriyañāṇaṃ cetasā ceto paricca viditaṃ hoti.

an6.62:8.18.pli: Evampi kho, ānanda, tathāgatassa āyatiṃ dhammasamuppādo cetasā ceto paricca vidito hoti.

an6.62:9.1.pli: Idha panāhaṃ, ānanda, ekaccaṃ puggalaṃ evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāmi:
an6.62:9.1.eng: When I’ve comprehended the mind of an individual, I understand:

an6.62:9.2.pli: ‘imassa kho puggalassa vijjamānā kusalāpi dhammā akusalāpi dhammā’ti.
an6.62:9.2.eng: ‘Both skillful and unskillful qualities are found in this individual.’

an6.62:9.3.pli: Tamenaṃ aparena samayena evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāmi:
an6.62:9.3.eng: After some time I encompass their mind and understand:

an6.62:9.4.pli: ‘natthi imassa puggalassa vālaggakoṭinittudanamattopi sukko dhammo, samannāgatoyaṃ puggalo ekantakāḷakehi akusalehi dhammehi, kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjissatī’ti.
an6.62:9.4.eng: ‘This individual has not even a fraction of a hair’s tip of goodness. They have exclusively dark, unskillful qualities. When their body breaks up, after death, they will be reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.’

an6.62:9.5.pli: Seyyathāpi, ānanda, bījāni khaṇḍāni pūtīni vātātapahatāni sukhette suparikammakatāya bhūmiyā nikkhittāni.
an6.62:9.5.eng: Suppose some seeds were broken, spoiled, weather-damaged. They’re sown in a well-prepared, productive field.

an6.62:9.6.pli: Jāneyyāsi tvaṃ, ānanda, nayimāni bījāni vuddhiṃ virūḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjissantī”ti?
an6.62:9.6.eng: Wouldn’t you know that those seeds would not grow, increase, and mature?”

an6.62:9.8.pli: “Evamevaṃ kho ahaṃ, ānanda, idhekaccaṃ puggalaṃ evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāmi:
an6.62:9.8.eng: “In the same way, when I’ve comprehended the mind of an individual, I understand …

an6.62:9.9.pli: ‘imassa kho puggalassa vijjamānā kusalāpi dhammā akusalāpi dhammā’ti.

an6.62:9.10.pli: Tamenaṃ aparena samayena evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāmi:

an6.62:9.11.pli: ‘natthi imassa puggalassa vālaggakoṭinittudanamattopi sukko dhammo, samannāgatoyaṃ puggalo ekantakāḷakehi akusalehi dhammehi, kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjissatī’ti.
an6.62:9.11.eng: ‘This individual has not even a fraction of a hair’s tip of goodness. They have exclusively dark, unskillful qualities. When their body breaks up, after death, they will be reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.’ …”

an6.62:9.12.pli: Evampi kho, ānanda, tathāgatassa purisapuggalo cetasā ceto paricca vidito hoti.

an6.62:9.13.pli: Evampi kho, ānanda, tathāgatassa purisindriyañāṇaṃ cetasā ceto paricca viditaṃ hoti.

an6.62:9.14.pli: Evampi kho, ānanda, tathāgatassa āyatiṃ dhammasamuppādo cetasā ceto paricca vidito hotī”ti.

an6.62:10.1.pli: Evaṃ vutte, āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
an6.62:10.1.eng: When he said this, Venerable Ānanda said to the Buddha,

an6.62:10.2.pli: “sakkā nu kho, bhante, imesaṃ tiṇṇaṃ puggalānaṃ aparepi tayo puggalā sappaṭibhāgā paññāpetun”ti?
an6.62:10.2.eng: “Sir, can you describe three other individuals who are counterparts of these three?”

an6.62:10.4.pli: “idhāhaṃ, ānanda, ekaccaṃ puggalaṃ evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāmi:
an6.62:10.4.eng: “Ānanda, when I’ve comprehended the mind of an individual, I understand:

an6.62:10.5.pli: ‘imassa kho puggalassa vijjamānā kusalāpi dhammā akusalāpi dhammā’ti.
an6.62:10.5.eng: ‘Both skillful and unskillful qualities are found in this individual.’

an6.62:10.6.pli: Tamenaṃ aparena samayena evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāmi:
an6.62:10.6.eng: After some time I encompass their mind and understand:

an6.62:10.7.pli: ‘imassa kho puggalassa kusalā dhammā antarahitā, akusalā dhammā sammukhībhūtā.
an6.62:10.7.eng: ‘The skillful qualities of this individual have vanished, but the unskillful qualities are still present.

an6.62:10.8.pli: Atthi ca khvassa kusalamūlaṃ asamucchinnaṃ, tampi sabbena sabbaṃ samugghātaṃ gacchati.
an6.62:10.8.eng: Nevertheless, their skillful root is unbroken, but it’s about to be totally destroyed.

an6.62:10.9.eng: So this individual is still liable to decline in the future.’

an6.62:10.10.pli: Seyyathāpi, ānanda, aṅgārāni ādittāni sampajjalitāni sajotibhūtāni puthusilāya nikkhittāni.
an6.62:10.10.eng: Suppose that there were some burning coals, blazing and glowing. And they were placed on a broad rock.

an6.62:10.11.pli: Jāneyyāsi tvaṃ, ānanda, nayimāni aṅgārāni vuddhiṃ virūḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjissantī”ti?
an6.62:10.11.eng: Wouldn’t you know that those coals would not grow, increase, and spread?”

an6.62:10.13.pli: “Seyyathāpi vā pana, ānanda, sāyanhasamayaṃ sūriye ogacchante, jāneyyāsi tvaṃ, ānanda, āloko antaradhāyissati andhakāro pātubhavissatī”ti?
an6.62:10.13.eng: “Or suppose it was the late afternoon and the sun was going down. Wouldn’t you know that the light was about to vanish and darkness appear?”

an6.62:10.15.pli: “Seyyathāpi vā, panānanda, abhido addharattaṃ bhattakālasamaye, jāneyyāsi tvaṃ, ānanda, āloko antarahito andhakāro pātubhūto”ti?
an6.62:10.15.eng: “Or suppose that it’s nearly time for the midnight meal. Wouldn’t you know that the light had vanished and the darkness appeared?”

an6.62:10.17.pli: “Evamevaṃ kho ahaṃ, ānanda, idhekaccaṃ puggalaṃ evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāmi:
an6.62:10.17.eng: “In the same way, when I’ve comprehended the mind of an individual, I understand …

an6.62:10.18.pli: ‘imassa kho puggalassa vijjamānā kusalāpi dhammā akusalāpi dhammā’ti.

an6.62:10.19.pli: Tamenaṃ aparena samayena evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāmi:

an6.62:10.20.pli: ‘imassa kho puggalassa kusalā dhammā antarahitā, akusalā dhammā sammukhībhūtā.

an6.62:10.21.pli: Atthi ca khvassa kusalamūlaṃ asamucchinnaṃ, tampi sabbena sabbaṃ samugghātaṃ gacchati.

an6.62:10.22.eng: This individual is still liable to decline in the future …

an6.62:10.23.pli: Evampi kho, ānanda, tathāgatassa purisapuggalo cetasā ceto paricca vidito hoti.

an6.62:10.24.pli: Evampi kho, ānanda, tathāgatassa purisindriyañāṇaṃ cetasā ceto paricca viditaṃ hoti.

an6.62:10.25.pli: Evampi kho, ānanda, tathāgatassa āyatiṃ dhammasamuppādo cetasā ceto paricca vidito hoti.

an6.62:11.1.pli: Idha panāhaṃ, ānanda, ekaccaṃ puggalaṃ evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāmi:
an6.62:11.1.eng: When I’ve comprehended the mind of an individual, I understand:

an6.62:11.2.pli: ‘imassa kho puggalassa vijjamānā kusalāpi dhammā akusalāpi dhammā’ti.
an6.62:11.2.eng: ‘Both skillful and unskillful qualities are found in this individual.’

an6.62:11.3.pli: Tamenaṃ aparena samayena evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāmi:
an6.62:11.3.eng: After some time I encompass their mind and understand:

an6.62:11.4.pli: ‘imassa kho puggalassa akusalā dhammā antarahitā, kusalā dhammā sammukhībhūtā.
an6.62:11.4.eng: ‘The unskillful qualities of this individual have vanished, but the skillful qualities are still present.

an6.62:11.5.pli: Atthi ca khvassa akusalamūlaṃ asamucchinnaṃ, tampi sabbena sabbaṃ samugghātaṃ gacchati.
an6.62:11.5.eng: Nevertheless, their unskillful root is unbroken, but it’s about to be totally destroyed.

an6.62:11.6.eng: So this individual is not liable to decline in the future.’

an6.62:11.7.pli: Seyyathāpi, ānanda, aṅgārāni ādittāni sampajjalitāni sajotibhūtāni sukkhe tiṇapuñje vā kaṭṭhapuñje vā nikkhittāni.
an6.62:11.7.eng: Suppose that there were some burning coals, blazing and glowing. They were placed on a pile of grass or timber.

an6.62:11.8.pli: Jāneyyāsi tvaṃ, ānanda, imāni aṅgārāni vuḍḍhiṃ virūḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjissantī”ti?
an6.62:11.8.eng: Wouldn’t you know that those coals would grow, increase, and spread?”

an6.62:11.10.pli: “Seyyathāpi vā panānanda, rattiyā paccūsasamayaṃ sūriye uggacchante, jāneyyāsi tvaṃ, ānanda, andhakāro antaradhāyissati, āloko pātubhavissatī”ti?
an6.62:11.10.eng: “Suppose it’s the crack of dawn and the sun is rising. Wouldn’t you know that the dark will vanish and the light appear?”

an6.62:11.12.pli: “Seyyathāpi vā panānanda, abhido majjhanhike bhattakālasamaye, jāneyyāsi tvaṃ, ānanda, andhakāro antarahito āloko pātubhūto”ti?
an6.62:11.12.eng: “Or suppose that it’s nearly time for the midday meal. Wouldn’t you know that the dark had vanished and the light appeared?”

an6.62:11.14.pli: “Evamevaṃ kho ahaṃ, ānanda, idhekaccaṃ puggalaṃ evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāmi:
an6.62:11.14.eng: “In the same way, when I’ve comprehended the mind of an individual, I understand …

an6.62:11.15.pli: ‘imassa kho puggalassa vijjamānā kusalāpi dhammā akusalāpi dhammā’ti.

an6.62:11.16.pli: Tamenaṃ aparena samayena evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāmi:

an6.62:11.17.pli: ‘imassa kho puggalassa akusalā dhammā antarahitā, kusalā dhammā sammukhībhūtā.

an6.62:11.18.pli: Atthi ca khvassa akusalamūlaṃ asamucchinnaṃ, tampi sabbena sabbaṃ samugghātaṃ gacchati.

an6.62:11.19.eng: This individual is not liable to decline in the future …

an6.62:11.20.pli: Evampi kho, ānanda, tathāgatassa purisapuggalo cetasā ceto paricca vidito hoti.

an6.62:11.21.pli: Evampi kho, ānanda, tathāgatassa purisindriyañāṇaṃ cetasā ceto paricca viditaṃ hoti.

an6.62:11.22.pli: Evampi kho, ānanda, tathāgatassa āyatiṃ dhammasamuppādo cetasā ceto paricca vidito hoti.

an6.62:12.1.pli: Idha panāhaṃ, ānanda, ekaccaṃ puggalaṃ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāmi:
an6.62:12.1.eng: When I’ve comprehended the mind of an individual, I understand:

an6.62:12.2.pli: ‘imassa kho puggalassa vijjamānā kusalāpi dhammā akusalāpi dhammā’ti.
an6.62:12.2.eng: ‘Both skillful and unskillful qualities are found in this individual.’

an6.62:12.3.pli: Tamenaṃ aparena samayena evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāmi:
an6.62:12.3.eng: After some time I encompass their mind and understand:

an6.62:12.4.pli: ‘natthi imassa puggalassa vālaggakoṭinittudanamattopi akusalo dhammo, samannāgatoyaṃ puggalo ekantasukkehi anavajjehi dhammehi, diṭṭheva dhamme parinibbāyissatī’ti.
an6.62:12.4.eng: ‘This individual has not even a fraction of a hair’s tip of unskillful qualities. They have exclusively bright, blameless qualities. They will become extinguished in this very life.’

an6.62:12.5.pli: Seyyathāpi, ānanda, aṅgārāni sītāni nibbutāni sukkhe tiṇapuñje vā kaṭṭhapuñje vā nikkhittāni.
an6.62:12.5.eng: Suppose that there were some cool, quenched coals. They were placed on a pile of grass or timber.

an6.62:12.6.pli: Jāneyyāsi tvaṃ, ānanda, nayimāni aṅgārāni vuḍḍhiṃ virūḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjissantī”ti?
an6.62:12.6.eng: Wouldn’t you know that those coals would not grow, increase, and spread?”

an6.62:12.8.pli: “Evamevaṃ kho ahaṃ, ānanda, idhekaccaṃ puggalaṃ evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāmi:
an6.62:12.8.eng: “In the same way, when I’ve comprehended the mind of an individual, I understand …

an6.62:12.9.pli: ‘imassa kho puggalassa vijjamānā kusalāpi dhammā akusalāpi dhammā’ti.

an6.62:12.10.pli: Tamenaṃ aparena samayena evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāmi:

an6.62:12.11.pli: ‘natthi imassa puggalassa vālaggakoṭinittudanamattopi akusalo dhammo, samannāgatoyaṃ puggalo ekantasukkehi anavajjehi dhammehi, diṭṭheva dhamme parinibbāyissatī’ti.
an6.62:12.11.eng: ‘This individual has not even a fraction of a hair’s tip of unskillful qualities. They have exclusively bright, blameless qualities. They will become extinguished in this very life.’

an6.62:12.12.pli: Evampi kho, ānanda, tathāgatassa purisapuggalo cetasā ceto paricca vidito hoti.
an6.62:12.12.eng: This is how another individual is known to the Realized One by encompassing their mind.

an6.62:12.13.pli: Evampi kho, ānanda, tathāgatassa purisindriyañāṇaṃ cetasā ceto paricca viditaṃ hoti.
an6.62:12.13.eng: And this is how the Realized One knows a person’s faculties by encompassing their mind.

an6.62:12.14.pli: Evampi kho, ānanda, tathāgatassa āyatiṃ dhammasamuppādo cetasā ceto paricca vidito hoti.
an6.62:12.14.eng: And this is how the Realized One knows the future origination of a person’s qualities by encompassing their mind.

an6.62:13.1.pli: Tatrānanda, ye te purimā tayo puggalā tesaṃ tiṇṇaṃ puggalānaṃ eko aparihānadhammo, eko parihānadhammo, eko āpāyiko nerayiko.
an6.62:13.1.eng: And so, Ānanda, of the first three individuals one is not liable to decline, one is liable to decline, and one is bound for a place of loss, hell.

an6.62:13.2.pli: Tatrānanda, yeme pacchimā tayo puggalā imesaṃ tiṇṇaṃ puggalānaṃ eko parihānadhammo, eko aparihānadhammo, eko parinibbānadhammo”ti.
an6.62:13.2.eng: And of the second three individuals, one is liable to decline, one is not liable to decline, and one is bound to become extinguished.”
